headline: Chipolo, an AirTag rival, debuts rechargeable trackers with a six-month battery life
summary: Chipolo debuts a lineup of rechargeable trackers to compete with AirTag and others.

headline: T-Mobile US (TMUS) Strengthens Disaster Readiness with Drones, Satellites, and Enhanced Network
summary: T-Mobile US (TMUS) recently unveiled a series of enhancements and investments aimed at improving connectivity and response during emergencies, showcasing a proactive approach to disaster readiness. In the last quarter, TMUS's stock price moved up 4%, which aligns with the general upward trend of the market during that period. This quarter's progression was bolstered by the company's solid infrastructure investments and strategic advancements through collaborations like the T-Satellite launch...

headline: T-Mobile bets on 'SuperMobile' plan to attract business customers
summary: -U.S. wireless network provider T-Mobile on Wednesday unveiled its new "SuperMobile" plan, which offers satellite connectivity and minimized latency, as it looks to add enterprise clients.  The launch introduces a new approach to business mobile plans by integrating network slicing, which ensures data moves faster and more reliably even during periods of heavy network traffic.  The plan combines satellite connectivity and built-in security to address common pain points for enterprise users, making it more appealing to companies seeking more sophisticated mobile infrastructure.

headline: T-Mobile Sets a New Standard for Business Phone Connectivity with SuperMobile
summary: BELLEVUE, Wash., August 27, 2025--Earlier this summer, T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS) was named the Best Mobile Network in America according to Ookla® Speedtest®, and now it’s driving innovation for business customers. Today, T-Mobile unveiled SuperMobile, the first and only business plan to combine intelligent performance, built-in security and seamless satellite coverage. Customers like Delta Air Lines and Axis Energy Services are already exploring new ways to get more from the best business plan on

headline: AT&T Strikes $23B Deal for EchoStar 5G Spectrum Licenses
summary: EchoStar’s 5G ambitions go back to 2019, and are the byproduct of another major telecom deal: T-Mobile’s acquisition of Sprint.
